  • Method Details

    • doOperation

      public void doOperation(ListADT<String> list) throws IOException
      Performs the operation on the given list. This method reads an infix expression from a file, converts it to postfix notation, and then performs the operation using a postfix calculator.
      Specified by:
      doOperation in interface ICalculator
      Parameters:
      list - the list to perform the operation on
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file

    • read

      public ListADT<String> read(String file) throws IOException
      Reads the contents of a file and returns a list of strings. Each string represents an element read from the file.
      Parameters:
      file - the path of the file to be read
      Returns:
      a list of strings representing the elements read from the file
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file

      Returns:

    • stringtoListADT

      public ListADT<String> stringtoListADT(String str)
      Converts a string into a ListADT object. Each word in the string is added as an element to the list.
      Parameters:
      str - the string to be converted
      Returns:
      a ListADT object containing the words from the string

    • infixToPostfix

      public String infixToPostfix(ArrayList<String> elements)
      Converts an infix expression to a postfix expression.
      Parameters:
      elements - the list of elements in the infix expression
      Returns:
      the postfix expression as a string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the parentheses in the infix expression are unbalanced

    • isOperand

      public boolean isOperand(String element)
      Checks if the given element is an operand. An operand can be a letter or a digit.
      Specified by:
      isOperand in interface ICalculator
      Parameters:
      element - the element to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the element is an operand, false otherwise
